AttackerCapabilities: Ability to generate colliding MD5 strings

Vulnerabilities: Use of base64 encoding for user-controlled input

Steps.Description: Craft a GET request with specific query parameters

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to manipulate the query parameters to pass the checks and obtain the flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a GET request with specific query parameters: darkctf=2020, ctf2020=WkdGeWEyTjBaaTB5TURJd0xYZGxZZz09, karma=M%C9h%FF%0E%E3%5C+%95r%D4w%7Br%15%87%D3o%A7%B2%1B%DCV%B7J%3D%C0x%3E%7B%95%18%AF%BF%A2%00%A8%28K%F3n%8EKU%B3_Bu%93%D8Igm%A0%D1U%5D%83%60%FB_%07%FE%A2, 2020=M%C9h%FF%0E%E3%5C+%95r%D4w%7Br%15%87%D3o%A7%B2%1B%DCV%B7J%3D%C0x%3E%7B%95%18%AF%BF%A2%02%A8%28K%F3n%8EKU%B3_Bu%93%D8Igm%A0%D1%D5%5D%83%60%FB_%07%FE%A2
StepDetails.Result: The webpage responds with the flag: DarkCTF{Flag : very_Flag : niceFlag : _web_challenge_dark_ctf}

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker needs to find two colliding MD5 strings to satisfy the last check.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker runs a script to generate the colliding MD5 strings using the provided hexadecimal values.
StepDetails.Result: The script generates two colliding MD5 strings: 008ee33a9d58b51cfeb425b0959121c9

Steps.Description: Encode the colliding MD5 strings and include them in the GET request

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker needs to include the encoded colliding MD5 strings in the GET request to pass the check.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker encodes the colliding MD5 strings and includes them in the GET request.
StepDetails.Result: The webpage responds with the flag: DarkCTF{Flag : very_Flag : niceFlag : _web_challenge_dark_ctf}
